snippet: Senior Kremlin officials said Russia’s Federal Migration Service had not yet received a formal appeal for asylum from Edward J. Snowden, the former intelligence contractor.
abstract: Verbal maneuvering by Russian officials hints at complex relationship between American fugitive Edward J Snowden and Russian government, which had clear role in arranging meeting between Snowden and lawyers and human rights advocates; Snowden asked human rights groups for assistance in securing safe passage to Latin America and requested asylum in Russia, but Russian officials say they have not received official asylum request.
lead_paragraph: Senior Kremlin officials said Russia’s Federal Migration Service had not yet received a formal appeal for asylum from Edward J. Snowden, the former intelligence contractor.

headline.main: Russian Officials Say They Didn’t Receive an Asylum Request From Snowden
headline.print_headline: Russian Officials Say They Didn’t Receive an Asylum Request From Snowden
